radiographic_examinations.findings: A right apical soft-tissue lesion (4.0 cm), enlarged bilateral axillary lymph nodes (up to 1.8 cm), and a large retroperitoneal soft-tissue mass extending into both kidneys with hydronephrosis of the right kidney.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: A massive conglomerate of enlarged lymph nodes from the level of the celiac axis to below the aortic bifurcation, marked attenuation of renal vessels, hydronephrosis of the right kidney, infiltration of soft tissue into the left kidney, and extension into the small-bowel mesentery.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Repeat CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
CT scan at the end of the initial treatment course
radiographic_examinations.findings: Complete resolution of the retroperitoneal mass.
A subcutaneous nodule in the thigh.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Evidence of an increase in the size of a nodule in the apical lung three months after the initial treatment.
